newsitem.title: USA: Philippine President Ramos to visit Oracle, buy NCs.
newsitem.headline: Philippine President Ramos to visit Oracle, buy NCs.

text.p: Philippine President Fidel Ramos plans to visit the headquarters of software giant Oracle Corp on Thursday to ask for help in setting up a national network based on network computers, a person close to the planned meeting said.
Network computers, or NCs, are stripped-down computers that get their computing horsepower from corporate or public computer networks, such as the Internet.

Oracle Chairman Larry Ellison, who runs the second-largest software company in the United States after Microsoft Corp., has been pitching the relatively cheap devices as the perfect way for less developed nations to quickly spread computer literacy.

The source said on Tuesday that executives from the Philippine Long Distance Telephone Company will sign a memorandum of understanding that asks Oracle to help develop an NC-ready network for universities and, eventually, Philippine companies.
The network will be based on software designed by Oracle.
Oracle, based in Redwood Shores, Calif., specializes in writing database software, which stores and retrieves huge amounts of information on computer networks.
Oracle itself does not make the NC hardware. Instead, the company sells the software that controls a network of NCs.
Financial terms of the agreement were not immediately available.
President Ramos has been touring California in recent days, promoting the Philippine as a stable place for investment.
